page.title: 15Kirkby in World War 2
page.content: There are some pupils in our school whose grandparents have lived in Kirkby for a very long time. Some lived or worked here during World War Two (1939-45). They describe how there were very few shops or buses in the town then an even how they were few lights and pavements. During the war, the timber yard in our block was taken over by the American Inland Sorting Depot. Also to help the war effort there were weapons made on what is now the industrial estate. They were made in ordinance factories.It was mainly women who worked there because so many men were away at war. So even a small place like Kirkby, as it was then, had an important part to play in the war.
